headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  PAPERT, FREDERIC S

snippet: PAPERT--Frederic S. The Board and Staff of 42nd Street Development Corp. mourn the loss of our founder, Frederic S. Papert, a tenacious and courageous leader who, as President, led 42nd Street Development Corp. for 39 years. Throughout those years, Fred played a prominent role in transforming the landscape of New York City, particularly the West End of 42nd Street. A resourceful and inspired visionary, Fred launched a mission to transform derelict and abandoned buildings along 42nd Street into a mecca of theatrical art and restaurants, now known as "Theatre Row." An avid lover of the arts, Fred supported fledging theatre groups with grants funded by our organization. As a preservationist, Fred teamed up with Jackie Kennedy Onassis to win the fight to save Grand Central Station from the wrecking ball. Fred's efforts to make NYC a more beautiful place were recognized through numerous honors and awards. We send our deepest condolences to Fred's daughters and their families. A. Jones Yorke, Board Chairman Wendy Rowden, President 1/3
lead_paragraph: PAPERT--Frederic S. The Board and Staff of 42nd Street Development Corp. mourn the loss of our founder, Frederic S. Papert, a tenacious and courageous leader who, as President, led 42nd Street Development Corp. for 39 years. Throughout those years, Fred played a prominent role in transforming the landscape of New York City, particularly the West End of 42nd Street. A resourceful and inspired visionary, Fred launched a mission to transform derelict and abandoned buildings along 42nd Street into a mecca of theatrical art and restaurants, now known as "Theatre Row." An avid lover of the arts, Fred supported fledging theatre groups with grants funded by our organization. As a preservationist, Fred teamed up with Jackie Kennedy Onassis to win the fight to save Grand Central Station from the wrecking ball. Fred's efforts to make NYC a more beautiful place were recognized through numerous honors and awards. We send our deepest condolences to Fred's daughters and their families. A. Jones Yorke, Board Chairman Wendy Rowden, President 1/3
